definition: (literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages

sentences.english: International business English teaching quality hearing can not be guaranteed.
sentences.chinese: 國際商務英語聽力教學質量無法保證。

sentences.english: Aural tests are objective and can be graded mechanically.
sentences.chinese: 聽力測驗是客觀的，可以機械地評分。

sentences.english: Questions in the Listening section are now also recorded.
sentences.chinese: 聽力部分的問題同時以錄音形式出現。

sentences.english: She has little vision, decreased hearing and cannot speak.
sentences.chinese: 她的視力不佳，聽力下降，也不能說話。

sentences.english: At Levels 5 and 6, the Vocabulary test measures listening vocabulary.
sentences.chinese: 在第五和第六級，單字測驗是以聽力爲主。

sentences.english: Zhou Lan and Bruce are talking about listening to English.
sentences.chinese: 周蘭和布魯斯正在談論關於英語聽力方面的事情。

sentences.english: Lesion of ossicular chain is a common ear disease impairing the sense of hearing.
sentences.chinese: 聽骨鏈病變是導致患者聽力水平下降的普遍病症。

sentences.english: Fetus already have hearing now and you can begin a prenatal education.
sentences.chinese: 胎兒已具備聽力，能聽見聲音，可開始進行胎教了。

sentences.english: Activity2: Listen to the tape and fill in the blanks.
sentences.chinese: 通過聽短文填詞，進行有目的的聽力訓練。

sentences.english: Theory, Aural, Technique, Song Writting, Improvisation Ideas.
sentences.chinese: 樂理，聽力，技術，作曲，即興。

sentences.english: Let Ss listen to music and describe this kind of music.
sentences.chinese: 利用學生喜歡的樂調對學生進行聽力能力的培養。

sentences.english: Professor Li, from Beijing University, will give a talk on how to improve our listening and spoken English.
sentences.chinese: 北大李教授將作如何提高英語聽力和口語能力的報告。

sentences.english: Q15: How do I choose good listening materials?
sentences.chinese: 我怎麼選好的聽力教材？

sentences.english: Student listening skills are also improved through music education.
sentences.chinese: 通過音樂教育，學生的聽力也同樣得以提高。

sentences.english: Unitron is a global producer of hearing aides.
sentences.chinese: 優利康聽力助手是一個全球生產。

sentences.english: Wax or foreign bodies blocking the ear canal can cause hearing loss at any age.
sentences.chinese: 蠟或異物阻塞耳道在任何年齡都會造成聽力喪失。

definition: variant of 復習|复习[fu4 xi2]
